text:
I ran flat-footed/
Pale and proud,/
Ankle barely flexed/
or flushed with exertion./
I ran in circles, tight/
With solitude./
This is when/
I knew I would die first./
This when I knew/
I could hardly change./
This had been my groove./
For years./
Another’s rut./
Another’s canyon deep./
My smooth./
